alert.note: Alert for Clark; Comanche (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:54AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Comanche and Clark Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Protection to near Rosston. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coldwater, Protection, Lake Coldwater and Buttermilk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
